meanings.definition: Charm or enchant (someone), sometimes in a deceptive way.
meanings.sent1: The magician beguiled the audience with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent2: She beguiled him with her sweet smile and kind words.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox beguiled the naive rabbit into sharing his carrots.
meanings.sent4: The sly salesman beguiled customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: The enchanting melody beguiled all who listened, transporting them to a magical world.

meanings.sent1: The con artist beguiled the old man out of his life savings.
meanings.sent2: She beguiled her friend into believing a tall tale.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child beguiled his sister into thinking she had superpowers.
meanings.sent4: The cunning villain beguiled the hero into a trap.
meanings.sent5: The deceptive email beguiled many unsuspecting recipients into revealing personal information.

meanings.sent1: They beguiled the evening with board games and laughter.
meanings.sent2: She beguiled the long train ride by reading a captivating book.
meanings.sent3: The friends beguiled the rainy day with a movie marathon.
meanings.sent4: He beguiled the waiting time by doodling in his notebook.
meanings.sent5: The soothing music beguiled the weary travelers during their journey.
